p.s: Starr went to a Just Us for Justice march, which takes place on the street where Khalil was shot and died.
After seeing the place where he died Starr sees the night and the death of Khalil playing again before her eyes.
Starr then notices Ms. Ofrah standing on top of a police car, she wears a shirt with Khalil's face on it.
Starr got overwhelmed by the large crowd and its chants and so she starts to chant aswell.
Ms. Ofrah spots Starr and heads to her.
They talk with eachother and Starr mentions that she wanted to do something.
Ms. Ofrah tells Starr that her voice is her biggest weapon and she encourages Starr to speak to the crowd.
Starr now stands on top of a cop car, with a crowd before her.
Starr speaks to the crowd and admits that she is the one who saw what happened to Khalil.
She calls the officer who shot him a criminal and the crowd cheers.
At the end of her speech she shouts His life mattered, Khalil lived to the crowd and directly to the police.
